Title: Tightened circuit breaker measures extended for another week; some activities allowed to resume from May 5
Summary: [u"SINGAPORE - Singapore's tightened circuit breaker measures will remain in place for another week, with\xa0businesses like barbers, home-based bakers and laundry services allowed to resume operating on May 12.", u'However, they would still have to abide by the precautions in place before April 21, when Singapore further tightened its circuit breaker measures.', u'Singapore entered its circuit breaker period on April 7, which is due to last until May 4.', u'On April 21, Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong announced an extension to the circuit breaker period to June 1, which came with more stringent safe distancing measures.', u'Then from May 12, selected businesses such as barbers, home-based businesses and laundry services will be allowed to resume operation.']

Title: Coronavirus: Schools to bring back small groups of students from May 19, with focus on graduating cohort
Summary: [u'Minister for National Development Lawrence Wong, who co-chairs the task force, said they would focus on the graduating cohorts taking national examinations.', u'They will meet teachers one-to-one, or in small groups.', u'SINGAPORE - From May 19, schools may start bringing students in small groups for face-to-face lessons as circuit breaker measures slowly ease up, said the multi-ministry task force tackling Covid-19 in a press conference on Saturday (May 2).', u'From June, depending on the situation then, the task force will review how much further schools can open up and how many more students can return.', u'"It\'s a small group," he said, adding that this will be done with safe distancing measures and that the students will be kept in separate groups within cohorts.']

Title: 60-year-old S'porean man dies of coronavirus, the 16th death here; 7 new clusters identified
Summary: [u'MOH said that there are 932 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore on Friday, taking the total count to 17,101.', u'The total number of people in Singapore who have fully recovered from the infection is 1,268.', u'SINGAPORE - A 60-year-old male Singaporean died on Friday (May 1) from complications due to Covid-19 infection, bringing the total deaths here to 16.', u'A total of 16 have died of Covid-19 complications, including a 58-year-old woman who died on Thursday.', u'The man was confirmed to have the coronavirus on April 13 and had a history of hypertension and hyperlipidaemia, said the Ministry of Health (MOH).']

Title: Progress Singapore Party expels member who made video claiming it had been infiltrated and funded by foreign proxies
Summary:
[u'SINGAPORE - The Progress Singapore Party (PSP) on Friday (May 1) expelled a member who made a video in the style of hacktivist group Anonymous in which he claims the party has been infiltrated and funded by foreign sources.', u'ST PHOTO: JASON QUAH 



"Upon the completion of internal investigations, the Progress Singapore Party has decided on the expulsion of this member.', u'This is the second time in as many months in which a PSP member has been expelled amid a police investigation.', u'Mr Teo told ST he made the video after receiving information from a third party, which he declined to name.', u'The Straits Times understands that police reports have been made by some of those named, including Mr Raymond and PSP member Ravi Philemon.']

Title: Why Music Matters: Singaporean conductor Kahchun Wong brings classical music to children
Summary: [u'SINGAPORE -\xa0With an aim to share their love of music with children, Singaporean conductor Kahchun Wong and Marina Mahler -\xa0the granddaughter of renowned composer Gustav Mahler -\xa0founded Project Infinitude.', u'The first episode of the seven-part digital series Why Music Matters offers a glimpse of the activities and impact of Project Infinitude.', u'Together with Child at Street 11 -\xa0a charity and pre-school for children from diverse and under-resourced backgrounds -\xa0the project provides an inclusive space for children to explore classical music.', u'Wong was introduced to music by his maths teacher and he wants to provide a similar opportunity for other kids.', u"Wong has been the chief conductor of Germany's Nuremberg Symphony Orchestra since 2018, yet he has always made time to return to Singapore to work with the children every other month."]

Title: After rumours about health, North Korea state news agency reports Kim Jong Un's appearance
Summary: [u'North Korean leader Kim Jong Un attends the completion of a fertiliser plant on May 1, 2020.', u'\n\nMr Kim was accompanied by several senior North Korean officials, including his younger sister Kim Yo Jong, KCNA said.', u'Mr Kim was seen in photographs smiling and talking to aides at the ribbon-cutting ceremony and also touring the plant.', u'The day is a major holiday in North Korea and Mr Kim as leader usually pays a visit to the mausoleum where his grandfather lies in state.', u'Reuters could not independently verify the KCNA report.']
